intro: Cola anomala, commonly known as the African cola tree, is a flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces woody pods containing hard, stimulant-rich seeds, which are traditionally used in various cultural and medicinal practices. Cola anomala thrives in humid, well-drained soils and requires a warm climate with high rainfall. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and economic contexts.
